results.title: Catching crocodiles
results.creator_credit: Noel Monkman and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film, showing aspects of the life of crocodile hunters on the Gulf of Carpentaria, was one of eleven short Australian educational films produced by Efftee Studios as a result of a partnership between naturalist Noel Monkman and Frank Thring Snr. Monkman photographed and directed the films and Frank Thring Snr narrated most of them. Two series were produced: the “Barrier Reef” series which consisted of five films and the “Australian Marvelogue” series, of which “Catching Crocodiles” is one of six. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Catapult
results.creator_credit: Andrew Vial and Andric Film Productions
results.brief_description: Catapult is a poetic film on the sport of pole vaulting and features dual Olympian Ray Boyd and Australian ex-champion Eddy Johnson. Both vaulters are seen in top form as they outdo each other in their attempts to set a new Australian pole vault record. Photographed and edited by Tony Paterson.

results.title: Cat journey
results.creator_credit: Lisbeth Gabrielsson, Educational Media International and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: Katie meets a friendly cat which takes her for a rather adventurous ride on its back. Their journey is full of many strange and sometimes scary encounters, but the cat is always there to save Katie. Adapted from the picture book by Ivar Arosenius. Suitable for children 4-7 years.

results.title: Castles made of sand
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents a visual ode to sandcastles and those who build them. Explores a sandcastle-building competition and leads the imagination to a variety of thoughts about sandcastle symbolism. Some are simple, some complex - perhaps parallelling the nature of their builders.

results.title: Casey draws the line.
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Beacon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
A dispute between two children over property boundaries gets out of hand when they cannot come to an agreement over the shared care of a rabbit. Lines are drawn and fences are erected. The position seems untenable until the unfortunate death of the rabbit. Raises issues about the attitudes and values attached to property and ownership.

results.title: Case of the hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the scope for improvement of storage and handling methods in industry, showing examples of good and poor practice, and the work of the National Materials Handling Bureau in the field.

results.title: Carved in ivory
results.creator_credit: Michael Gill, Arts Council of Great Britain and Concord Films
results.brief_description: Examines small ivory sculptures created by anonymous masters from 700-1200 A.D. Much of their work decorates devotional objects such as croziers, crosses and caskets and their themes are mainly religious. Includes carvings from collections in Brunswick, Brussels, Copenhagen, Munich, Paris and New York besides a number from the Victoria and Albert and other museums in Britain. Describes these art objects in their historical and artistic context. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.
